TopicTitle: Project Alexandria: a history of spaceflight done in Real Solar System

Articles.Content: You're right. I barely have time to make episode 7 lately. I won't be making any other changes right now. I've tried RVE before with direct help from pingo and Nathan, and still didn't get it working for me.
Edited March 30, 2015 by Felbourn
I have to say, I am truly impressed by your attention to every single detail.

Well then!! You have done this!! Their blood is on your hands!! Because of your arrogance THIS HAS HAPPENED!!

I hope you know I did not want to do this. I hope you see now that my resolve cannot be broken! Don't test me! You have one week again!! Next time it will be 200 kerbals I promise the machine will not be as humane next time! Good day sir!

[h=1]It is only when a mosquito lands on your testicles that you realize

There is always a way to solve problems without using violence - Confucius Say[/h]
Don't go all pacifist on it though.. Been scratching all morning :-/

So Bob, I was wondering if we were going to see the new episode of Alexandria this Monday or not. You said it was about half done last week, when you had been working on it for a week. So, I figured that the other half probably took the same amount of time to make. Please let me know(if you have the time to) if I'm right or not. Either way I can't wait for the new episode!
Edited March 30, 2015 by Felbourn
Well 1961 is probably the busiest year you will do tbh.
My narration is only up to 29 minutes. I still need to add another whole flight too.

Take your time! If you are anything like me, the more you (or we) obsess with dates, the likelier it'll be they will slip. I'm sure it'll be worth the wait.

Rune. It's done when it's done!

That may be true, though, without deadlines, nothing would ever get done!
My narration is only up to 29 minutes. I still need to add another whole flight too.

Honestly if its easier for you Bob just drop the monday deal all together and release them as you see fit. But regardless above all else. Make sure you keep it as a hobby, y'know? One doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t need two jobs. Do whatever you gotta do to keep it fun. As for 1961 being the busiest... hard to say. I always figured the Apollo flights would be more time consuming. But i guess at that point there isnt much to cover on the Soviet side of things. Although we will need one big explosion when you cover the N1 thats a given, lol. Anyway its a hell of a task you've taken on here Bob and i appreciate it greatly. I hope to be able to use Alexandria to show and teach my kids someday. Hell i know ive already learned alot.

Boom! 1961 has begun!

Edited April 1, 2015 by Felbourn

Boom! 1961 has begun!

Poyekhali!

Edit: Wait a second. Where is the awesome sound of the R-7's turbopump spinning up before the engines fire with that characteristic "Thud"? I loved how you always got that awesome sound right!

Edit2: Ok, Vostok's sound is as it's supposed to be, it's only Venera's R-7 that skips the turbopump ignition sequence. And you put it twice there! Now that is better fan service . The bang of the hypergolic cartridges igniting, the fast-changing pitch of the turbopump raising the hairs on your back, then the THUD of engine ignition. Gives me goosebumps every time!

Rune. Also, thanks for something to watch while I have breakfast

Edited April 1, 2015 by Rune

Thanks, Rune. I had to get this episode done before I quit playing KSP, because I was so close to finished with it anyway. I'm glad you liked it. I think it was a good episode to be my last one ever, don't you? But now, these are taking me too long to make, so I am quitting KSP for good. Good luck in your own endeavors! See ya later Kerbonauts!

Thanks, Rune. I had to get this episode done before I quit playing KSP, because I was so close to finished with it anyway. I'm glad you liked it. I think it was a good episode to be my last one ever, don't you? But now, these are taking me too long to make, so I am quitting KSP for good. Good luck in your own endeavors! See ya later Kerbonauts!

I totally understand. Take care!
Too easy.
VERY funny, Felbourn! Happy April Fools Day!

Haha nice

Both the video that I enjoyed and the fact that your "retirement" was only a joke.

I have to say i shed a tear during gagarins launch. Not only for the historical event but also because "ÃÅ¸ÃÂ¾ÃÂµÃ‘â€¦ÃÂ°ÃÂ»ÃÂ¸" was something I said to a very special person as she was heading off to long stay in london nearly tree years ago.
what does, "ÃÅ¸ÃÂ¾ÃÂµÃ‘â€¦ÃÂ°ÃÂ»ÃÂ¸" mean? I honestly do not understand Russian!

Y'know I knew it was April 1st and my heart still skipped a beat, lol. Congrats on this episode Bob and thank you. This made my Wednesday.

Edit: Amazing episode. Again just learning the little details that i can apply to my own flight here is half the fun. Question though... have you considered an alternate skybox by chance? Ive been using 5thHorseman's skybox for years. It is beautifully accurate. Being able to recognise the constellations is a plus too.

Edited April 1, 2015 by Motokid600

OH! Ok, Thanks! that makes sense!

Hey, I found a PDF that might be helpful later for Mir. It has some good information on the dimensions of the modules.

http://ston.jsc.nasa.gov/collections/TRS/_techrep/RP1357.pdf
